meanings.definition: To move unsteadily from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The toddler began to wabble as he tried to walk on his own.
meanings.sent2: The ship started to wabble in the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to wabble gracefully on the ice, but ended up slipping comically.
meanings.sent4: The leaves wabble in the wind, dancing to nature's tune.
meanings.sent5: Her knees wabble with fear as she stood on the edge of the cliff.

meanings.sent1: The wabble of the tree branches in the wind was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: She felt the wabble of the bridge beneath her feet.
meanings.sent3: The wabble of the boat made everyone on board giggle.
meanings.sent4: The wabble of the old chair made it feel like a rocking horse.
meanings.sent5: The wabble of the jelly on the plate caught her eye, making her smile.
